analyzed: theḥ apadāna  eka pad umiya vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekapundarika

analyzed: tīṇuppala māliya tthera apadāna  candabhāgā nadī tīre

translated: “At that time, on the bank of the Candabhāgā River,🔽I was a monkey.
sitting in the middle of a mountain.
Endowed with the major and minor marks,
with a mind elated with rapture,
on the head of the Great Seer Vipassī,
While going, with a contorted face,
I reached the end of my life.
and by my intention and aspiration,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽Three times I was a god-king

analyzed: deva rajjam akārayi  satānam pañcakkhattum ca

translated: and five times I was a wheel-turning monarch.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus has it been told by the Elder Tīṇuppalamāli.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tīṇuppalamāliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Tīṇuppalamāliyattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā tīṇuppalamāliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽tīṇuppalamāliya therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: The Story of the Elder Tīṇuppalamāli is finished.
